sub_topic: Determining the isomerism of a molecule
message_1: Determine the type of isomerism of the molecule CH3CH2CH2OH and draw its corresponding isomer(s).
message_2:
The molecule CH3CH2CH2OH is propanol, specifically 1-propanol. The type of isomerism exhibited by this molecule is structural isomerism, specifically chain isomerism. This occurs when the carbon skeleton of the molecule is rearranged, but the molecular formula remains the same.

The corresponding isomer for CH3CH2CH2OH is 2-propanol (isopropanol). The structural formula for 2-propanol is:

CH3-CH(OH)-CH3

So, the two isomers are:
1. 1-propanol: CH3CH2CH2OH
2. 2-propanol (isopropanol): CH3-CH(OH)-CH3
